Improving | Front end Developer

Aug / 2021 – Feb / 2024

Project Owner Insite: At Owner Insite, I meticulously debugged and resolved a series of complex UI issues within the Owner Insite legacy project, ranging from cross-browser compatibility problems to responsive design flaws. My toolkit included HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript ES6, alongside frameworks like jQuery for DOM manipulation and Bootstrap for layout and styling. Despite my primary focus on front-end development. Furthermore, I spearheaded the creation of a comprehensive library of visual components tailored for the new V3 project version at Owner Insite. This library, built with Angular 13 and TypeScript, featured reusable and modular components such as custom form controls, navigation bars, and data visualization widgets, all adhering to the Material Design principles. This initiative not only accelerated the development process but also ensured a consistent and modern user interface across the application

Project Exym> Front End Developer I carried out a complete transformation of the Exym app’s user interface, strictly adhering to the Material Design guidelines to ensure a cohesive and accessible user experience. Using Angular 13 and TypeScript, I developed dynamic and reactive components that integrate seamlessly with the Material UI framework. This approach allowed for the creation of an interface rich in interactivity and visually appealing, leveraging Agular’s two-way data binding capabilities and optimized animations for smooth navigation and instant user feedback. Agular’s modular architecture also facilitated clear code organization and future scalability of the project.
